macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: Global Equities Rally to Record Highs; Tech Stocks Rebound
items.summary: The MSCI All Country World Index reached a fresh record, up 0.2%, with Asian markets leading the surge at 1.3%. US technology stocks rebounded strongly, easing concerns about AI spending overheating, as the S&P 500 finished near local highs.

items.title: Dow Jones Surpasses 50,000 Milestone for First Time
items.summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average broke through the 50,000 barrier on Friday, February 6, driven by a rebound in technology, AI, and chip stocks following a volatile week. The index reached a new record close on Monday amid optimism about corporate earnings.

items.title: Key US Economic Data Expected; Fed Rate Path in Focus
items.summary: Traders are positioned for critical US macroeconomic data that could reshape expectations for the Federal Reserve's rate path, including the NFIB Small Business Optimism report and ADP employment change figures.

items.title: TSMC Reports Strong Revenue Growth; Chip Sector Momentum Continues
items.summary: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing reported January revenue of 401.6 billion New Taiwan dollars ($12.73 billion), up 20% from the previous quarter and 37% year-over-year, signaling continued strength in the semiconductor supply chain.

items.title: Mixed Corporate Earnings; Notable Gainers and Decliners
items.summary: AstraZeneca rose 2.5% on strong quarterly results, while Upwork plummeted 24% after weak revenue guidance and ZoomInfo Technologies fell 11% on slower growth projections. Credo Technology surged 15% after raising revenue expectations.

items.title: Gold Pulls Back After Two Sessions of Gains
items.summary: Gold experienced profit-taking after recent gains in a higher-volatility trading environment, as the market attempts to build a stable base following an earlier sharp selloff.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Price Slips Below $70,000 Amid Rangebound Trading and US Data Anticipation
items.summary: Bitcoin fell 2.2% to $69,392 in Asian hours on February 10, 2026, after failing to hold gains above $70,000 following a rebound from $60,000 lows. Investors are cautious ahead of key US CPI inflation data on Friday and potential hawkish Fed policy under nominated chair Kevin Warsh.

items.title: Bitcoin Holds Above $70,000 with Bullish Technical Signals Targeting $75,000
items.summary: Bitcoin traded at around $70,800 on February 10, 2026, up from year-to-date lows of $60,100, forming a bullish flag pattern with RSI rising. Analysts recommend buying with a take-profit at $75,000, citing reduced volatility and Japan's pro-stimulus election boost.

items.title: South Korean Exchange Bithumb Accidentally Sends $44 Billion in Bitcoin to Users
items.summary: Bithumb mistakenly credited 620,000 bitcoins ($44 billion) to users during a promo on Friday, causing a sell-off before recovering 99.7%. South Korea's financial watchdog calls for stricter crypto regulations to address systemic issues.

items.title: Bitcoin Briefly Surpasses $70,000 USDT on Binance
items.summary: Bitcoin crossed the 70,000 USDT mark early on February 10, 2026, trading at 70,115 USDT according to Binance data, amid narrowed fluctuations.

items.title: Bitcoin's 2026 Slide Disrupts Industry Tokenization and ETF Plans
items.summary: Experts discuss how Bitcoin's recent decline is challenging crypto ecosystem innovation, including ETF tokenization, with major firms like Morgan Stanley enabling advisor access to spot Bitcoin ETFs.

items.title: Altcoins Decline as Market Remains Subdued
items.summary: Ethereum dropped 2% to $2,052, XRP fell 1% to $1.43, Solana eased 1.6%, while Cardano, Polygon, and Dogecoin also declined amid Bitcoin's rangebound trade.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: University of Michigan Develops Prima AI for Rapid Brain MRI Analysis
items.summary: Researchers at the University of Michigan created Prima, an AI system that interprets brain MRI scans in seconds with up to 97.5% accuracy, outperforming other models and prioritizing urgent cases. The technology, published in Nature Biomedical Engineering, could transform brain imaging in health systems.

items.title: ZKBoost: New Zero-Knowledge Protocol for Verifiable XGBoost Training
items.summary: Researchers introduced ZKBoost, a cryptographic protocol enabling verification of XGBoost model training on sensitive data without revealing it, maintaining near-perfect accuracy and efficiency via CertXGB certification. The work advances privacy-preserving machine learning for sensitive applications.

items.title: SwitchBot Launches AI Hub, First Local Home AI Agent Supporting OpenClaw
items.summary: SwitchBot released AI Hub, an edge device providing always-on local AI with Vision-Language Models for smart home automation, privacy-focused video analysis, and upcoming OpenClaw integration for device control. It enables VLM-based event interpretation and home reports without cloud dependency.

items.title: Max Planck Researchers Show AI Benefits from 'Dosed Nonlinearity' in Sequence Models
items.summary: Study proves models with partial nonlinearity outperform fully linear or nonlinear ones, especially with limited data, by acting as context-dependent switches, offering a data-efficient design for transformers used in chatbots like ChatGPT.

items.title: Yale Introduces spEMO AI Tool for Integrating Tissue Imaging and Multi-Omics Data
items.summary: Yale researchers developed spEMO, an AI system combining tissue slide images with gene and protein data to reveal cell interactions in diseased tissue, enhancing understanding of disease mechanisms as published in Nature Biomedical Engineering.

items.title: Clemson University Expands Access to OpenAI's ChatGPT Edu
items.summary: Clemson partnered with OpenAI to provide free ChatGPT Edu access to students, faculty, and staff, supporting its AI Initiative with advanced tools for researchers and a human-centered approach to AI in education.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: CyberConnect2 Announces 30th Anniversary Game Project Reveal on February 16
items.summary: CyberConnect2 will unveil a completely new video game title as its 30th anniversary project on February 16, described as a culmination of the company's technology, strength, and courage.

items.title: Xsolla Showcases New Brand and Tools for Developers at DICE Summit 2026
items.summary: Xsolla is participating in the DICE Summit in Las Vegas from February 10-12, highlighting its platform for video game commerce, including web shop solutions for mobile games to enable direct-to-consumer models.

items.title: Crisol: Theater of Idols Releases Today on PS5, Xbox Series X|S, and PC
items.summary: The first-person action horror game Crisol: Theater of Idols, set in a nightmarish version of Mexico City, launches on February 10, 2026.

items.title: Gaming Corps Partners with High Flyer Casino for Ontario iGaming Expansion
items.summary: Swedish game developer Gaming Corps has signed a content deal with Ontario's High Flyer Casino, rolling out slots like 3 Pigs of the Caribbean and Savannah Stacks to players.

items.title: Fight-Quest Demo Features Gnome-Punching Fantasy Action
items.summary: A new demo for Fight-Quest, a fantasy game where players punch adorable gnomes, is now available, highlighted as a fun upcoming title.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.
